snippet: Recent legal movements are fraught with trouble for a country founded on the idea that church does not dictate to state.
abstract: Timothy Egan Op-Ed column contends Republican opposition to Arizona bill that would allow businesses to discriminate against gay marriages underscores that religious exemption from laws clashes with the idea that the church does not dictate to the state; maintains bill exposed nuttiness behind movement purporting to protect faith by allowing discrimination, which is at issue in Supreme Court case regarding birth control coverage as part of the health care reform law.
lead_paragraph: Recent legal movements are fraught with trouble for a country founded on the idea that church does not dictate to state.
